SparkleSocks22

I'm not sure where to put this but since the Tibet situation is current I'll put it here.
 
 I was recently doing a human rights paper and I stumbled upon Tibet. I was first going to do women's sufferage as my topic but when I came across Tibet I decided to give it a shot.
 
 I wanted to know how much you guys know about Tibet and if you think what is going on now is wrong or right? Do you think the USA should step in and help a little more then they are doing? It's been like 50 years and nothing has happened but millions of deaths!!
DarKnight

The question is not if the US should help, the question is if the US even can help. We're not talking about Afganastan or Iraq here, were talking about CHINA oppressing a people. It's an extremeley delicate subject even for asian's to talk amongst themselevs let alone getting foreigners involved! Any solution would be a long arduous diplomatic journey just to get started.
SparkleSocks22

The chinese government hides this from their people. The majority of them don't know what is going on. I had no idea this was happening until I came upon it for a research paper. They are trying to keep it "hush hush" but I think we need to do SOMETHING! I can't just sit around and watch what's happening, Tibetans are being opressed and killed by the million! They don't fight back because they don't believe in it, so why can't we help and find a peaceful way for them to settle this. The Tibetans weren't bothering anyone...*shakes head*
DarKnight

Believe me, the chinese public know about it only to well it's just, like I said, it's something that you just don't talk about for fear of pi$$ing of the government (and you DON'T want to pi$$ off the chinese government).
 
 I agree with you of course, it's just a subject that is even more sensitive then North Korea. I guess I could give it more thought but the stealth politics involved are the kind of thing you'd expect to find in the cold war you know what I mean?
SparkleSocks22
Yea I know where you're coming from...I just wish there was a way that we could help.
Aryana
Come on, the Tibetans are being enriched by the wonders of diversity.
DarKnight
Unless that's your weird way of saying "rounded up and sloughtered" I'm afraid I have no idea what your talking about.

 Peter: Yeah they do, honey.

 Peter: Hello? China? I've got something you want. 
 <some sounds over the phone<
 You know what I want.
 <some sounds over the phone<
 Yes. ALL THE TEA.
SparkleSocks22

Yea WHAT are you saying Aryana?!
 They are being slaughtered and killed by the million! Most are monks and nuns that are being killed, thrown into death camps, and/or prison. A monk who handed out freedom pamphlets was sentenced to prison and beaten severely. He is now in a death camp working for nothing because he will be killed soon.
Aryana
I was being sarcastic. This treatment of the Tibetans (genocide) is one of the "benefits" of different races/peoples competing for the same territory. One group will eventually win...
DarKnight

You know, asia's a pretty big place, no-one has to "win" they can quite eaily live together (besides, genetic diversity may cause such hybridisation through the natural mingling of the gene pools that they will all eventually be the same race anyway).
